definition:
A topological space $X$ is an *absolute retract* if, for every embedding
of $X$ as a closed subset of a normal space $Y$, the image of $X$ is a
retract of $Y$.

A topological space $X$ is an if, for every embedding of $X$ as a closed
subset of a normal space $Y$, the image of $X$ is a neighborhood retract
of $Y$.
